A brilliant continuation to the Confession. There are a few surprises along the way. Fantastic acting. The twists and turns leave you wondering who Katie will choose to marry. A wonderful family friendly film you can share with everyone. No foul language and no nudity. Enjoy!

Not true to the book at all. The first movie was excellent. The second was only so-so. The third, however, is painfully bad. The lead character is a horrible actress with a bad accent she kept slipping in and out of. What's with the strange faces, over-acting, and wrinkled nose? The movie was so bad that it took us two evenings to get through, and only then because we paid for it and couldn't return it. Definitely NOT recommended. Stick to the books instead.

Love that the whole series was made. Hope more of Beverly Lewis is made into movies.

The tone of the movie is different from the first two, because so many of the actors have been changed from the first two movies. This movie in no way follows the books except for when Rosie wrote a letter to Katherine's Amish mother; and her mother responded. It made the Justin character seem like he was just helping Katherine run the estate and not actualyl be a lawyer as mention in the second movie. Justin Worth her love interest has no character, or charisma in the movie to make it more of a challenge for Katherine to pick between the two. I like the Justin in the second movie better. However the actor who played Daniel is older in this movie and portrayed the character better. Daniel didn't get enough screen time though. Katie/Katherine did get to meet her father in the movie, however not in the book. Justin was an artist not a lawyer as in the book. And Daniel didn't go into service in the original book, but faked his drowning accident so his family and Katie/Katherine wouldn't be shunned. Daniel wanted to join the Mennonite church. In the book Katherine had a shocked/delayed reaction to Daniel appearing after his supposed death. Katherine's reaction in the movie was too dramatic, drawn out, and sudden. I would recommend the movie because it gives closure to the series and not as mainstream Christian message like in the book, quoting scripture. In a way I think the movie gave more closure to the series. Why? You'll have to watch to see.
